decision_conditions: The replacement trees must be planted by April 2024; the trees should be of a small species of either Sorbus spp, Amelanchier spp or prunus spp that is suited to the site. | Failure to do so will result in a tree replacement notice under section 207 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | It is recommended that planting takes place between the months of October and March but being careful to avoid periods of waterlogging or hard frost. | If the new tree's species is different from that removed, then Ealing's Planning department must be consulted before planting is completed.
description:
T2608 - Sorbus - Low Vigour/Failing - Fell tree
TP0 843 T2607 - Cherry - Crown reduce removing up to 1.5m
TPO 843 T2041 - Cherry - Crown reduce removing up to 1m
T2040 - Sorbus - Crown reduce removing up to 1m
T2042 - Sorbus - crown lift to approx 2.5m
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
